answers.answer: I know some women bleed right before the start of labor. It tends to happen when the cervix begins to dilate. Did they check to see how many cm you are? I would rest and take it easy. As far as shaking and your headache, did they check your blood pressure. Preeclampsia may be something to have them look for if they didn't already. Personally I would go back but it's up to you.

Did they not test the blood? When I had a bleed at 39wks they took some and it was from the placenta as it was shutting down. Not saying thats where its from because I'm not a doctor. Do they think it could be the start of a bloody show? Some women have this before labour starts?x
No they only checked my blood pressure temperature checked the babys movements did a internal scan aswell as a normal scan but the bleeding has stopped (I think) I just feel unwell
I would call again if I was you. Tell them your still not well and see what they say. Better to be safe than sorry x

question: I got admitted to hospital last night due to bleeding where I had tightening and cramps I hardly slept due to all the babys crying and this morning I was throwing up aftet the nurses gave me breakfast im still slightly bleeding but was aloud to go home but was told to go back in if I throw up again had more bleeding or my waters break and the thing thats worrying me like CRAZY is the doctor said they dont know where the bleeding is coming from im sat at home now lying on the sofa with a massive headache feeling energy less and sick and shaky any advice please girls reply im scared something is seriously wrong with me im 35wks 3ds
title: omg is this normal I feel terrible :(
